lines.text: Well, I'll tell you what happened to her. While you were touring China, she went through hell. It's a nice place, you must go there someday.
You've changed all right! You're selfish, hard.
Sure I am, just like glass. So hard, nothing'll cut it but diamonds. Come around some day with a fistful. Maybe we can get together.

[to baby daughter]
Maybe... maybe you'll take a mother's advice before she goes. You might as well. That's the only thing she's got to give. Don't ever let any man make a sucker out of you. Make him know what you're worth. Anything they get for nothing is always cheap.

[to her newborn daughter]
Why couldn't you have been a boy? This world's such a tough place for a girl to come to.

[to Mother Angelica]
Dora's the kind of girl that some guy always wants to marry. I get a lot of proposals, but marriage isn't one of them.
A woman must suffer much before she can sing a little.
Come back to me in about a year.

[Smiling ironically]
All right. In the meantime watch me suffer.
The next time you go in for rescue work, pick out someone who wants to be saved. I don't.
Well, it's too disgusting! To think of that disreputable woman talking every evening to America's dear little kiddies!
She's an evil influence invading a million decent homes!
How would you like to have such a creature in your home?
